author: Rob Biedenharn
content:
The Columbus/Cincinnati group includes Doug Alcorn, Jim Weirich, Rob Biedenharn, Joe O'Brien, Craig Muth, (and more). I think there were about 10 or 12 of us at the last meeting.

-Rob

author: the daniel
content:
I love the js lambda stuff, though I like to have point in the function body:

<code>
(defun my-javascript-lambda () (interactive) (insert "function () {\n};")
(backward-char 3)
(newline-and-indent))

</code>

author: Doug
content: "Emaculate Strike Force" sounds good.  Let's get a more detailed hit list and let folks just start knocking them off!

author: Josh
content:
Phil,

This is great that you're spearheading this effort. There is certainly a lot of interest in emacs from the rails/ruby folks, especially here in Columbus. We've got our own group dedicated to the integration between the 2. http: //groups.google.com/group/emacs-unite Currently, we're investigating el4r a little more, but there is some good emacs-lisp chops within the group as well.
